       AN ACT to amend chapter 654 of the laws of 1927, relating to joint water

         board of trustees of the Westchester joint water works

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 7 of section 3 of chapter 654 of   the laws  of
    2  1927,  relating  to joint water works systems, as amended by chapter 232
    3  of the laws of 2006, is amended to read as follows:
    4    7. Each member of the board of trustees shall be entitled  to  receive
    5  the sum of ten dollars as compensation for his OR HER attendance at each
    6  meeting of the board of trustees except that each member of the board of
    7  trustees  of  the  Westchester  joint  water  works shall be entitled to
    8  receive the sum of up to [one] TWO hundred dollars. Prior to the  opera-

   10  cost of acquisition thereof.  After the commencement of the operation of
   11  such a system said compensation shall be chargeable to the cost of oper-

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2336

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend chapter 654 of the laws of 1927, relating to joint water works
systems, in relation to compensation paid to members of the board of
trustees of the Westchester joint water works

PURPOSE:
To allow the Westchester Joint Water Works, a non-profit utility, the
authority to increase the per meeting compensation of the members of
the Board of Trustees.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1 amends Subdivision 7 of section 3 of chapter 654 of the laws
of 1927, as amended by chapter 232 of the laws of 2006, raising the
limit of trustee compensation up to $200 per meeting.

JUSTIFICATION:
The members of the Board of Trustees had not had an increase in
compensation for over 15 years, prior to 2006; a slight increase was
authorized from the prior per meeting amount ($60), but the
complexity of running the utility has added a significant number of
hours to their management responsibilities. They have requested the
authority to consider an increase for an amount not to exceed $200
per meeting. Any actual increase will be the decision of the Board of
Trustees, all of whom are the chief elected officials of the
jurisdictions served by the Joint Water Works: the Town of
Mamaroneck, the Village of Mamaroneck, and the Town/Village of Harrison.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10: S.3071-A.6527-B (Oppenheimer/Latimer) Vetoed, Memo 6774 of 2010
2005-06: A.10388-B (Latimer) Signed Chapter 231
2005-06: S.7444-B (Oppenheimer) Signed Chapter 232

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None to the State,

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
